TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TablePattern extends System.Windows.Automation.GridPattern

Docs.summary: Represents controls that act as containers for a collection of child elements. The children of this element support and are organized in a two-dimensional logical coordinate system that can be traversed by row and column.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This control pattern is analogous to <xref:System.Windows.Automation.GridPattern> with the distinction that any control that supports TablePattern also exposes a column or row header relationship, or both, for each child element.
Controls that support the TablePattern control pattern also support the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.GridPattern> control pattern in order to provide access to the inherent grid functionality of a table.
See [Control Pattern Mapping for UI Automation Clients](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) for examples of controls that may implement this control pattern.

Docs.summary: Gets the cached [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] property values for this .
Docs.value: A structure containing the cached [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] property values for the control pattern.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Cached property values must have been previously requested using a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.CacheRequest>. Use <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TablePattern.Current%2A> to get the current value of a property.
For information on the properties available and their use, see <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TablePattern.TablePatternInformation>.

Docs.exception: The requested property is not in the cache.

Docs.summary: Identifies the property that gets the collection of column headers for a table.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TablePatternIdentifiers>.
The order of the headers returned will be consistent within a provider, but not necessarily across providers.
This property is not present in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TablePattern.TablePatternInformation> and must be retrieved by using <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.GetCurrentPropertyValue%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.GetCachedPropertyValue%2A>.
## Examples In the following example, an array of <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> objects representing the primary row or column headers of a table is retrieved.
For the purposes of this example, a relationship between the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TablePattern.TablePatternInformation.RowOrColumnMajor%2A> property and the row and column header items is demonstrated. However, a table can have row and column headers regardless of the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TablePattern.TablePatternInformation.RowOrColumnMajor%2A> property of the table.
[!code-cs[UIATablePattern_snip#1025](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/UIATablePattern_snip/UIATablePattern_snippets.cs#1025)] [!code-vb[UIATablePattern_snip#1025](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/UIATablePattern_snip/UIATablePattern_snippets.vb#1025)]

Docs.summary: Gets the current [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] property values for this .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This pattern must be from an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> with an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElementMode> reference in order to get current values. If the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> was obtained using <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElementMode>, it contains only cached data, and attempting to get the current value of any property raises an exception. Use <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TablePattern.Cached%2A> to get the cached value of a property that was previously specified using a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.CacheRequest>.
For information on the properties available and their use, see <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TablePattern.TablePatternInformation>.

## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TablePatternIdentifiers>.
The pattern identifier is passed to methods such as <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.GetCurrentPattern%2A> to retrieve the control pattern of interest from the specified <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>.
## Examples In the following example, a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TablePattern> control pattern is obtained from a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>.
[!code-cs[UIATablePattern_snip#101](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/UIATablePattern_snip/UIATablePattern_snippets.cs#101)] [!code-vb[UIATablePattern_snip#101](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/UIATablePattern_snip/UIATablePattern_snippets.vb#101)]

Docs.summary: Identifies the property that gets the collection of row headers for a table.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TablePatternIdentifiers>.
The order of the headers returned will be consistent within a provider, but not necessarily across providers.
This property is not present in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TablePattern.TablePatternInformation> and must be retrieved by using <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.GetCurrentPropertyValue%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.GetCachedPropertyValue%2A>.
## Examples In the following example, an array of <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> objects representing the primary row or column headers of a table is retrieved.
For the purposes of this example, a relationship between the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TablePattern.TablePatternInformation.RowOrColumnMajor%2A> property and the row and column header items is demonstrated. However, a table can have row and column headers regardless of the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TablePattern.TablePatternInformation.RowOrColumnMajor%2A> property of the table.
[!code-cs[UIATablePattern_snip#1025](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/UIATablePattern_snip/UIATablePattern_snippets.cs#1025)] [!code-vb[UIATablePattern_snip#1025](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/UIATablePattern_snip/UIATablePattern_snippets.vb#1025)]

## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TablePatternIdentifiers>.
## Examples In the following example, a root element is passed to a function that returns a collection of <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> objects that are descendants of the root and satisfy a set of property conditions. This example retrieves the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>s that support <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TablePattern> and where the RowOrColumnMajorProperty is either <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RowOrColumnMajor> or <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RowOrColumnMajor>.
[!code-cs[UIATablePattern_snip#100](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/UIATablePattern_snip/UIATablePattern_snippets.cs#100)] [!code-vb[UIATablePattern_snip#100](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/UIATablePattern_snip/UIATablePattern_snippets.vb#100)]
